title: H is for Hawk - use of sensory details

content.question: The sensory details in paragraph 1, sentences 2-12 (“Her eyes . . . for flight”) primarily serve to

choices.label: convey the extremity of the hawk’s natural aversion to being handled
characterize the psychological traits of a successful hawk trainer
illustrate how the hawk’s behavior strengthens its connection with the author
foreshadow the eventual bond between the author and the hawk

content.answer: convey the extremity of the hawk’s natural aversion to being handled

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Identify and explain claims and evidence within an argument.
